name: Living Dead
description: You exist in the strange state between life and death. Neither fully alive nor completely dead, you possess the resilience of the undead while retaining fragments of your former humanity.

options.name: Undead Nature
options.description: You are considered undead and can be affected by spells that target undead creatures. You cannot recover health from any source or benefit from consumables such as a potions, food or drink, nor do you require air to breath. Instead, you regenerate an extra +7 health and +4 resolve after completing a full rest.

options.name: Unnatural Resilience
options.description: Your undead nature grants immunity to diseased, poisoned, bleeding, broken and numbed conditions. You also gain +5 dark mitigation. However, when you reach 0 resolve, you automatically become maddened which lasts until you die.

options.name: Undying
options.description: Your undead constitution grants you an additional +10 health, but you can no longer benefit from morale. When you reach 0 health, you cannot be stabilized, so you will naturally die when you run out of resolve to keep you in lifeline. However, you still regenerate health and resolve during a full rest even when dead, as well as regenerate any missing limbs unless your body is completely destroyed.

options.name: Reaction : Still As Death
options.description: In response to taking damage, you fall down in a heap, indistinguishable from real death.
